title: Help identifying these 2 fonts
content:
Please can anyone tell me the names of these two fonts and/or some suggestions for something similar.

Many thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016214808/http:/typophile.com/files/font2_10.jpg) | 68.68 KB |
| [font1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016214808/http:/typophile.com/files/font1_7.jpg) | 40.25 KB |
author: suebush

comments.content:
A new leaf is sort of similar to [Base 9 & 12](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016214808/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/base-9-and-12/)  
also very similar to the beautiful [Houschka](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016214808/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-g-type/houschka/) by our very own Nick Cooke.

New and much improved: [Houschka Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016214808/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-g-type/houschka-pro/)

I may do a condensed style one of these years.

Nick Cooke

Many thanks, I may just have to make a purchase!

No idea about the other font?

I've seen "font2" before..in a sample in a book called ABZ published by Chronicle Books. I checked the index..but it tells me that the designer is unknown, but it's apparently from Hungary, ca 1930. And it's from the collection of some guy called Jan de Jong.

Sorry..
